content:
Uses:
The TE7 Max is a general purpose diagnostic ultrasound system intended for ultrasound imaging, measurement, display, and analysis of the human body and fluid.
Components:
The TE7 Max Ultrasound system comprises a LED monitor with a high-resolution display, a touch-enabled interface with customizable multi-gesture support, a large storage basket designed for greater utility, a sealed interface designed for fluid resistance and ease of disinfection, elevated transducer mounting, dedicated disinfectant holder, and a retractable cord intended to reduce tripping hazards and contamination.
Features:
The TE7 Max is provided with an extensive suite of specialty transducers and AI-powered software applications, contended to enhance patient outcomes.
The TE7 Max’s cardiac imaging and capabilities, including Auto EF and TEE imaging, combined with automated fluid management tools designed for Critical Care environments. 
The TE7 Max is equipped with needle enhancement technologies such as eSpacial Navi 4D magnetic needle navigation technology and iNeedle+ visualization technology designed to help streamline workflow and improve accuracy with needle-guided procedures.
The TE7 Max host a suite of AI tools such as:
Smart B-Line is designed to enable rapid assessment of lung tissue by automatically calculating number and area percentage of B-Lines according to user-selected protocols.
Smart FHR designed to provide automated fetal heart rate calculation utilizing B-mode echo data.
Auto EF is designed to provide proprietary technology to analyze 2D echo data to automatically calculate EDV/ESV/EF for left ventricle function evaluation.
Smart VTI is designed to provide automated Velocity Time integral (VTI) and Cardiac Output (CO) measurements enable rapid cardiac function assessment.
Smart IVC is designed to provide automated measurement of Inferior Vena Cava (IVC) helps assess volume status and guides fluid management.
Smart Bladder is designed to provide automated measurement of bladder volume to pre and post void measurements.

Modes of operation for the system include: B, M, PWD, CWD, Color Doppler, Amplitude Doppler, Combined mode, Tissue Harmonic Imaging, Contrast imaging,TDI, Color M, Smart 3D, and iScape View
